Radon measures and continuous functions
Since a Radon measure ¬µ is characterized on M(¬µ) by its behavior on the fam-
ily of compact/open sets of R

(see Chapter 2), integration with respect to ¬µ on

(R

(R

(R

Riesz‚Äôs theorem shows that this correspondence actually provides an alter-
native characterization of Radon measures, and naturally leads to the notion
of vector-valued Radon measure (Section 4.2). From Riesz‚Äôs theorem we de-
duce compactness criteria in weak-star convergence for sequences of Radon
measures. This natural notion of convergence enjoys good lower semicontinu-
ity properties, and allows us to describe in a uniÔ¨Åed framework sequences of
functions and surfaces undergoing concentration, oscillation, cancellation, and
spreading-of-mass phenomena (Section 4.3).
